medical_history.chief_complaint: New chest pain and near syncope in a 19-year-old man; new dyspnea and left calf pain in a 45-year-old woman.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The 19-year-old man presented with new chest pain and near syncope. The symptoms were acute with no specified duration. The 45-year-old woman reported new dyspnea and left calf pain, with the onset being recent as well.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Neither patient had previous venous thromboembolism.
medical_history.family_history: The mother's history of two miscarriages at 10 weeks of gestation and a maternal grandfather with deep venous thrombosis at 60 years of age; the 45-year-old woman reported family history of pernicious anemia, Graves disease, and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.
medical_history.social_history: Both patients denied recent travel, trauma, surgery, or hospitalization.
